itemDescription: British official in the Chinese service

wikipedia_page.main: Sir Francis Arthur Aglen  (安格聯; 17 October 1869 – 26 May 1932) was a servant of the Chinese Imperial Customs, later to be the Chinese Maritime Customs, rising through the service to become Inspector-General of the Chinese Maritime Customs Service from 1911 to 1927 after the death of Sir Robert Hart.

response: *Francis Arthur Aglen, Inspector-General of the Chinese Maritime Customs
